title: 114_s2125
content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Community Advantage Program, defining a covered institution as a development company or nonprofit intermediary eligible to participate in the program. The Community Advantage Program covers institutions eligible to participate, including development companies, nonprofit intermediaries, and certified community development financial institutions. The Community Advantage Program includes nonprofit organizations approved by the Small Business Administration and defines a Reservist as a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces. The Community Advantage Program defines a Reservist as a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces and specifies terms like 'service-connected' and 'small business concern in an underserved market'. An underserved market refers to a small business located in a low- or moderate-income community, a HUBZone, or a designated empowerment zone with over 50% of employees residing in a low- or moderate-income community. The Community Advantage Program under section 1391 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 targets small businesses meeting specific criteria, including having over 50% of employees residing in a low- or moderate-income community, being in existence for less than 2 years, and being owned and controlled by veterans or service-disabled veterans. The Advantage Program targets small businesses owned and controlled by veterans, service-disabled veterans, members of the Armed Forces, Reservists, or spouses of veterans. The Transition Assistance Program includes Reservists, spouses of veterans, members of the Armed Forces, and surviving spouses of veterans. A Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small businesses owned by veterans and their spouses. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small businesses in underserved markets, with a maximum loan amount of $350,000. The program consists of loans to small businesses in underserved markets with a maximum loan amount of $350,000. The Administrator will promulgate regulations similar to the Community Advantage Pilot Program within a year of enactment. The text chunk discusses the amendment to the Small Business Act, specifically regarding the Community Advantage Pilot Program. The amendment prohibits the Administrator from carrying out the program once new regulations are in effect. Additionally, there are technical and conforming amendments made to Section 3(r) of the Small Business Act. The Small Business Act is being amended to include provisions related to the Community Advantage Pilot Program. The amendment also includes technical changes to Section 3(r) of the Act. The Small Business Act is amended to include provisions for the Community Advantage Pilot Program and technical changes to Section 3(r) of the Act, such as redesignating subparagraphs and adding a definition for a covered institution. The Federal Home Loan Bank Act is amended to expand the purposes of advances and collateral available to community development financial institutions.
